intro: Brevoortia ida-maia, commonly known as the Ida-Maia anchoveta, is a small, silvery fish found primarily in the coastal waters of the western Atlantic Ocean. It belongs to the family Engraulidae, which includes various species of anchovies. This species is typically found in shallow, brackish, and coastal waters, often near estuaries and tidal zones. Brevoortia ida-maia plays an important ecological role as a forage fish, supporting larger marine predators. Its streamlined body and rapid swimming ability help it thrive in its dynamic habitat.
